alert.note: Alert for Barry; Jasper; Lawrence; McDonald; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 18 at 2:06AM CDT until June 18 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Newton County in southwestern Missouri... McDonald County in southwestern Missouri... Barry County in southwestern Missouri... Lawrence County in southwestern Missouri... Central Jasper County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 300 AM CDT. * At 204 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Goodman to 7 miles north of Bella Vista to near Garfield, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. This line of storms has produced significant wind damage across northeastern Oklahoma and southwestern portions of McDonald County. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Goodman around 210 AM CDT. Neosho around 215 AM CDT. Seligman around 220 AM CDT. Wheaton around 225 AM CDT. Cassville, Granby and Fairview around 230 AM CDT. Diamond around 235 AM CDT. Duenweg around 240 AM CDT. Carterville and Pierce City around 245 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Table Rock Lake, Roaring River State Park, Big Sugar Creek State Park, Dodge, Shell Knob, Butterfield, Golden, Carytown, Fidelity and Emerald Beach. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 12 and 49. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 15, and between mile markers 36 and 52. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms have produced widespread wind damage across northeast Oklahoma and McDonald County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If on or near Table Rock Lake, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
